sentence.text: Farmer Manuel got all of the animals.
He opened the door to the cow's pen.
The cow walked to the corral.
Manuel opened the goat's pen, and the goat walked to the cow.
The chicken flew down and sat on the cow's back.
Manuel opened the goat's pen.
The goat walked to the cow.
The chicken flew down.
Then the chicken sat on the cow's back.
Farmer Manuel gathered all of the animals.
When he opened the door to the cow's pen, the cow walked to the corral.
Then, Manuel opened the goat's pen, and the goat walked to the cow.
Then after the chicken flew down, she sat on the cow's back.
Manuel said, \"Today is Monday.
On Sunday a judge comes to see if we are the best farm.
Let's work hard this week to get the prize for the best farm!
We need to clean up and look good.\"
The cat was so excited that she jumped into Manuel's arms.
On Sunday a judge comes.
The judge will see if we are the best farm.
The cat was so excited.
The cat jumped into Manuel's arms.
Manuel said, \"Today is Monday,
and on Sunday a judge comes to see if we are the best farm.
We need to clean up, so we can look good.\"
On Tuesday, Farmer Manuel helped the animals to look good.
He combed the goat's fur to make it clean and soft.
He carried the milk bucket to the cat.
The cat drank the milk which makes her fur shiny.
He combed the goat's fur.
Combing makes the fur clean and soft.
Manuel carried the milk bucket to the cat.
The cat drank the milk.
The milk makes the cat's fur shiny.
Then, he carried the milk bucket, which was full of milk to the cat.
Next, Manuel gave an apple to the horse.
Eating an apple cleans the horse's teeth.
Manuel pulled the cart to the pumpkins.
Then, he put a pumpkin in the cart and pulled the cart back to the barn.
Last, Manuel gave the pig the pumpkin to eat to make him fat.
All of the animals were happy.
Then, he put a pumpkin in the cart.
Manuel pulled the cart back to the barn.
Last, Manuel gave the pig the pumpkin to eat.
Eating pumpkins make the pig fat.
Next, Manuel gave an apple to the horse because eating an apple cleans the horse's teeth.
Manuel pulled the empty cart to the pumpkins.
Then, he put a pumpkin in the cart and pulled the heavy cart back to the barn.
On Wednesday, Farmer Manuel cleaned the farm.
He told the animals that to win the Best Farm Award the farm has to be clean.
Manuel first put the horse into the corral, and then he put the cow into the corral.
He can clean the barn better with big animals in the corral.
Then he put the pig into its pen.
To win the Best Farm Award, the farm has to be clean.
To clean the barn, Manuel puts the big animals in the corral.
Manuel put the horse into the corral.
Then Manuel put the cow into the corral.
On Wednesday, Farmer Manuel wanted to clean the farm very well and tidy it up.
He told all the animals that to win the Best Farm Award, all the tools must be in place and the farm has to be sparkly clean.
Manuel first put the horse and the cow into the corral, because he can clean the barn better with the big animals in the corral.
Manuel walked to the pumpkins.
He wanted to be sure that there were no weeds in the pumpkin field.
After checking the pumpkins, Manuel walked back to the barn.
He picked up the hay and carried it to the hayloft.
Oh no! Manuel fell off the hayloft, and the hay fell too.
Manuel will have to rest inside for the next 3 days.
Manuel checked the pumpkins.
Then Manuel walked back to the barn.
Manuel picked up the hay.
He carried the hay to the hayloft.
Oh no! Manuel fell off the hayloft.
The hay fell too.
Manuel walked to the pumpkins to be sure that there were no weeds in the pumpkin field.
After checking the pumpkins for weeds and other messes, Manuel walked back to the barn.
After more cleaning around the floor in the barn, he picked up the hay and carried it to the hayloft.
Oh no! When he got to the top, Manuel fell off the hayloft, and the hay fell too.
Because of his injury, Manuel has to rest inside the farm for the next 3 days.
The chicken said, \"Cat, cat, come here and purr to me so that I can lay eggs.
I want to be the best animal.\"
The cat jumped up to the chicken's nest.
The cat said, \"I cannot purr to you because I am thirsty.\"
The horse said, \"Goat, goat, come here and bring me an apple.
I want to be the best animal.\"
The chicken said to the cat, \"Come here and purr to me so that I can lay eggs.
But then the cat said, \"I cannot purr to you because I am thirsty,\" which made the chicken sad.
The horse then said to the goat, \"Come here and bring me an apple to clean my teeth and make them sparkly.
But the goat said, \"You cannot have my apple because I am hungry, too.\"
Then, the goat ate the apple.
The cow said to the horse, \"Bring me some hay so I can look healthy and strong.
I want to be the best animal.\"
But the horse ate the hay.
The horse said, \"I will eat hay until I get my apple.\"
So now, all of the animals were sad.
Then, the goat ate the apple, which upset the horse.
But the horse ate the hay, which angered the cow.
Manuel wanted to make the animals happy again.
He called his friend, the wise owl.
The owl flew to Manuel.
Manuel asked the owl to find out why the animals were sad.
First, the owl flew to the chicken and said, \"Why are you sad?\"
After resting from his injury, Manuel wanted to make the animals happy again.
He called his friend, the wise owl, to help him solve the problem with the sad animals.
The chicken flew to her nest and counted her eggs.
The chicken said, \"I cannot be the best animal with only one egg.\"
Then the owl flew to the pig and said, \"Why are you sad?\"
The pig said, \"I cannot be the best pig without eating pumpkins.
But, I am locked in my pen and cannot get to the pumpkins.\"
The wise owl flew to Manuel and said, \"I have an idea.\"
But, I am locked in my pen and therefore, I cannot get to the pumpkins to make me fat.\"
The owl flew to the chicken and whispered in her ear.
The chicken hopped to the pig's pen and opened the gate.
The pig ran to the pumpkins and ate one.
Then the pig took an apple to the horse.
The wise owl flew to the chicken and whispered in her ear how to help the pig.
Then the chicken hopped to the pig's pen and opened the gate so he could get out.
The pig then ran to the pumpkins and ate the best looking one.
Then the pig took an apple to the horse because it would help clean its teeth.
The horse pushed the hay to the cow.
The cow said, \"Cat, come and get some milk from the bucket.\"
The cat ran to the bucket and licked the milk.
The cat was so happy that she jumped up to the chicken's nest and started to purr.
The chicken went back to her nest, listened to the cat, and started to lay eggs.
Then the horse pushed the hay to the cow.
The cow called the cat to come and get some milk from the bucket.
The cat ran to the bucket and licked all the milk to make her fur shiny.
The chicken went back to her nest to listen to the cat, which helped her lay many eggs.
It was Sunday. The judge walked to the cow.
She tasted the cow's milk from the bucket.
\"Mmmm, that's really good milk,\" she said.
Then the judge counted the chicken's eggs, \"One, two, three, four!\"
Next the judge walked to the pig.
\"You are the fattest pig in the world,\" she said.
It was finally Sunday, judgment day. The judge walked to the cow to examine it carefully.
Then, she tasted the cow's milk from the bucket.
The judge thought to herself out loud \"Mmmm, that's really good milk\".
Then the judge went to the hayloft and counted the chicken's eggs, \"One, two, three, four!\"
Next the judge wanted to inspect the pig, so she walked to its pen.
She thought out loud \"You are the fattest pig in the world\".
The judge walked to the corral door.
The horse ran as fast as the wind and stopped next to the judge.
The judge said to Farmer Manuel, \"You have the best animals and the best farm in the country.\"
She gave Manuel the beautiful trophy.
All of the animals cheered. They had worked together to become the best farm!
The judge walked to the corral door to check the horse.
To show off its grace and speed, the horse ran as fast as the wind and stopped next to the judge.
She then proceeded to give Manuel the most beautiful trophy that the animals had ever seen.
All of the animals cheered because they had worked together to become the best farm! And thus, as a team they accomplished their lofty goal.
